data.title: Happy to have this lunch option
data.text: The East Town neighborhood is noticeably lacking dining options but we are fortunate to have Bar Zia which has a good variety on their menu along with friendly service.  The burgers and pizza are both very good.

data.title: Game Day Fun
data.text: The staff in the place rock it! It's game day with a couple hundred people in there and the staff is making sure that not a single person goes dry. Nicely done!

data.title: No happy hour during events at stadium
data.text: It was expensive beers and we were disappointed there was no happy hour before the concert at U.S Bank Stadium

owner_response.author: MplsTJ, Manager at Bar Zia, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We are competitively priced for downtown Minneapolis (the highest taxed city in the US). We do not offer happy hour during events at the stadium nor do any other bars that we know of during events. This is due to increased cost on the businesses end. For our regular customers we honor our 2-4-1 tokens during events. Our beers are still a couple bucks cheaper than the stadium ;)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nothing special- lunch menu
data.text: We went here for a business lunch- pretty expensive for what was actually provided. Pretty average food but the potato chips were good. Service was alright.

data.title: Time to Bicker ,,,,,,,
data.text:
Went in right before Happy Hour, Bartender was nice and allowed Happy Hour pricing, I attempted to enjoy their decent selection of local Draw beers. Bartender was worth good conversation. They had good eats and decent deals for their happy hour. However the place lacked people... LIttle cold not to much of a warm feeliing. When the manager had gotten there he and the bartender started to spat back and forth,  when the bartenders replacement arrived those two started to spat... Noticed a pattern paid my tab and left. 
Haven't been back.

owner_response.author: MplsTJ, Manager at Bar Zia, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry to hear of your experience, being the manager, I have never spat with an employee in front of house. Perhaps you seen an issue take place between two bartenders? It can be our slow time just before happy hour (when a second bartender comes on). I'm glad you were able to take part in happy hour pricing prior to happy hour start time. I will look into any employee issues as I have not heard of any arising. We have a great staff here and everyone treats each other like family. Again sorry for what you experienced!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: bar zie
data.text: This is a sports bar and offers natural drinks from fresh fruit, which is very good for a reasonable and calories

data.title: Late Night Lazy Hangout
data.text: Located a block away from the federal courthouse. This is a great place to unwind, get comfort food, or just have a couple of drinks to wind down the day. Wait staff is tremendously friendly. Comfort food is ok. Full service bar. Limited wine selection. Good beer selection. All in all, a really good respite from the federal courthouse after a long arduous day.

data.title: Great Happy Hour!
data.text: Good variety of beer and a good drink menu.  Happy hour apps are very good and reasonably priced.  If you have a larger group, they can seat you in a room separated from the bar - service is still very attentive.

data.title: Hungry and a free drink ticket
data.text: Anything would have tasted good.  We were hungry.  I had a hamburger, my brother spaghetti and my friend had pizza.  They were out of most everything you asked for.  The poor bartender was apologetic and nice.  Under new ownership so they need to get the place stocked.

owner_response.author: Travis P, Manager at Bar Zia, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I apologize for your experience. We are not under new ownership, we do have Busters pizza and Burgers now operating our kitchen and they have gotten rave reviews for their food. I am sorry if you were mis informed by the server. Could you please be more clear as to what we were out of?
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfect Pizza
data.text: We found Bar Zia after asking two police officers working downtown for directions to the stone bridge and eating suggestions. They told us to go to Bar Zia for good beers and great pizza and assured us we would not be disappointed. We were quickly greeted and seated and the waitress once again highly recommended the pizza. We ordered pizza and house salads and we were not disappointed. The salad was very fresh and was not just thrown in a bowl like so many salads are. When the pizza arrived it was brought out by a young man that I assumed was the chef and he had a look on his face like "I made this and you're going to love it". The pizza was perfect to say the least. We have had pizza all over the United States and we prefer small independent restaurants over the chains because of fresher ingredients and more care in the preparation. The pizza was a thin crust type and the crust was perfectly done. There was an abundance of toppings and on my first bite I could tell that the mushrooms were fresh and I was looking forward to finding the next one. We ordered a medium and it was really to much for the two of us but we almost finished it because it was just that good. If we lived in Minneapolis were would be regulars at Bar Zia. BTW, the young man stopped by our table again to ask about the pizza and he is lucky we both didnt jump up and give him a hug.

data.title: Really not worthy
data.text: At lunch time we (5 people) were the only one at the bar and we had to wait 50 minutes and when the food arrived it wasn't good at all. The home made chips and fries were soaked in  oil and even the rest wasn't good. The price is way too high for what we had. The waitress never tried to make up for the delay, she apologized at the end when was tip time!

owner_response.author: Travis P, Manager at Bar Zia, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I apologize for the wait time, we did have a day within the last week we briefly lost natural gas during a very busy lunch rush.  Most likely due to the construction all around us. May have been the day you stopped in as it was the only day we had a female server working lunch. Our equipment all runs on natural gas and there were issues getting it all back up and running, we worked with half the equipment needed. You should have been informed right away. Starting next week kitchen operations at Bar Zia will be ran by Busters pizza and burgers. We will have an entire new menu with much faster food! I again apologize for the poor service and wait time and hope that if you are ever in Minneapolis again you give us another chance.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun and chilled out
data.text: This bar is really relaxed and fun. The guys behind the bar that served us were very nice and polite and took time to chat to us which was cool. They also accepted our UK ID's which a lot of places won't for some reason. Beers were reasonably priced too and they had a great selection. I drank the 'bar zia' all evening, I wish they had it in England!

data.title: Bar Zia - ok, but not great
data.text: we went for lunch and our group of 6 were the only people in the place.  Service was ok, but food took forever!  One guy ordered their signature burger and it came with the paper still on the slice of cheese.  Took another 20+ minutes to get a replacement burger.  Because it is very convienient to where we work, we will try for happy hour but probably not for lunch again

owner_response.author: Travis P, Manager at Bar Zia, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry about the bad experience with the food at Bar Zia. Busters pizza and burgers will be operating the kitchen at Bar Zia starting August 12th. We hope your group will come back in and try us out for lunch again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bummer...  No more deep dish downtown!!
data.text:
We went for deep dish 12/07/14 and although the bar is open and there is a food menu, the fantastic pizzas are no longer part of this location. 

Bummer!!!!

data.title: Great place for a get-together!
data.text:
The pizza sauce is the real star of their pizza!  It has a sweet taste in the beginning and then a spicy, tangy final taste!  Absolutely yummy.  The cheese curds have a great beer batter....different from the Minnesota State Fair cheese curds (if that's what you're used to), in a good way!   The "brookie" - a chocolate brownie/cookie combination with whipped cream and blueberries is to die for!  Nice texture and chocolate taste without being sickening sweet.  Drinks were perfect.  The staff was very attentive and friendly.   
There are a few tables outside on the sidewalk if you want to be outdoors.  
There is a parking ramp next door and street parking.

data.title: Wonderful special event location!
data.text: We had a welcome home party here after our first visit back following three years living abroad.  Had about 75 guests and served pizza, salad, wings, and cheesecake. The event was great and co-owner Travis worked with us to plan everything perfectly.  Great location, beautiful setting, awesome food, and incredible service (so many guests commented on the amazing, attentive servers)!  Travis even helped us do a slide show of photos from our time living abroad and let us decorate the place!  Wonderful event and I can't thank them enough!  Highly recommended!

data.title: Chicago style pizza in Mpls.!
data.text: My son loves Chicago style pizza and wanted to try this place out. The pizza is amazing! All our sides and salads were excellent also. Great service, can't wait to go back :)

data.title: If i dident know any better i would say this is a gay bar
data.text: Great looking place but serivce was so so took forever to get my fries very clicky staff with their regular people i dident feel very welcomed..good drinks tho.

owner_response.author: Travis P, Manager at Bar Zia, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We apologize for your experience, we are not a "gay bar" but welcome all! We are very proud of the diversity Minneapolis has. We hope to see you again soon and your experience is better!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Pizza in Minneapolis
data.text: This is outstanding thin crust pizza. Get it half baked to finish at home; also freezes well. Extra toppings seem more expensive than elsewhere. We generally get only sausage or pep. Take out only and a must try if one likes pizza.

data.title: Chicago pizza close to home
data.text: I love Chicago style pizza, and was excited to try Di Noko's. Their online menu makes it easy to order, and it was ready right on schedule. I liked the seasoned beef topping (not usually my first choice, but Chicago pizza isn't my husband's favorite--compromise is key!); it was spicier than I expected, which I liked. I was a little disappointed by the crust. I like a thick, hearty crust; this was a thin crust in a deep-dish pan. The flavor was good, just a different texture than I expected. The sauce also had really good flavor. All in all, it was very good, and we'll order it again. They have no seating, so it's takeout or delivery only.
